segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of the message and to transmit identifying number and type of the message.
DTM, A segment to indicate the date of the preparation of the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify the document or message to which the current message relates, and related date and time.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference which applies to the entire message, e.g. reference to previous message.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify a party and related contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify liner service, carrier, consortium, container terminal or other party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within the party.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying the means of transport and related details.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to identify the means of transport and discharge voyage number.
LOC, A segment to identify the locations to which the following information applies.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time of events in local time, else the time zone must be indicated.
RFF, A segment to identify the loading voyage number.
FTX, A segment to transmit general information.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments containing information about the equipment and/or goods to be discharged or to be loaded and its (intended) stowage location on board a means of transport.

segment.documentation: HAN, A segment to specify the type of handling, e.g. discharging or loading.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: SG10-SG11 A group of segments containing information about the location, the identification and the type of equipment and other details regarding equipment and/or goods to be handled.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a stowage location relevant to the equipment or goods carried.
RFF, A segment to give reference numbers on equipment or goods carried (i.e. reference numbers allocated by the carrier for special goods and/or equipment).
FTX, A segment to transmit the goods description, additional equipment details or other relevant free text.
MEA, A segment specifying physical weights related to an equipment detail or a goods item detail.
DIM, A segment to identify off-standard measurements (e.g. overheight, overlength, overwidth, etc.).
LOC, A segment to identify the locations (ports) to which the given information applies.
NAD, A segment to identify the owner/operator of a particular piece of equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to specify a temperature (and range).

segment.documentation: TMP, A segment which identifies the temperature setting in relation to an equipment detail.
RNG, A segment to indicate a minimum and maximum range of temperatures in relation to an equipment detail.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments containing information about the number and type of equipment or the identification of the equipment to be loaded or discharged.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to identify a single piece of equipment or the type and number of equipment to which the following details apply. Only transport equipment size/type coded or plain language is used here to further identify the equipment.
EQN, A segment to identify the number of units.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments containing information about the number or the identification of attached equipment.

segment.documentation: EQA, A segment to identify the type and/or identification of equipment attached to the main piece of equipment.
EQN, A segment to identify the number of units of attached equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments containing information about the number of packages and kind of goods.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify the number of packages of the goods.
GDS, A segment to describe the nature of the cargo.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments containing information about dangerous cargo.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to indicate a reference number allocated by the carrier to a piece of equipment containing dangerous cargo.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods and additional information.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment which identifies dangerous goods related to an equipment or goods detail.
FTX, A segment which gives additional information concerning dangerous goods.
